title: WAG Kyly Clarke says judging House Rules is the dream job
text:
Kyly Clarke was announced as one of the new judges for the 2020 season of House Rules this week.

And speaking to The Daily Telegraph at a press event for the Seven network in Sydney on Wednesday, the cricket WAG and lifestyle guru said it's her 'dream job'.

'This is bringing two of my career loves together, interior design and TV presenting,' the 38-year-old explained.

'It's the dream job': Kyly Clarke (centre), 38, said she relishes her role as a new judge on Seven's House Rules. Pictured from left to right: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Saul Myers, Kyly, Abbey Gelmi and Jamie Durie

Kyly shared similar thoughts alongside a filtered selfie posted to Instagram on Friday.

Pouting for the camera while seated on a domestic flight, the wife of Australian retired cricketer Michael Clarke, encouraged fans to never stop working hard.

'Dreams don't work unless you do. Make the most of every moment and give all you have peeps (sic),' she wrote in the caption. 'Sending love and light for your evening and tomorrow, may you shine and prosper. Happy weekend ahead.'

Encouragement: The interior designer told her Instagram fans on Friday to continue working hard, alongside a filtered photo of herself seated on a domestic flight

Kyly will star as a judge on the revamped home renovation series, alongside Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and tradesman and comedian Saul Myers.

Jamie Durie has been promoted to host, having previously been a judge, and will be joined by model Abbey Gelmi.

House Rules: High Stakes will see eight teams proving their worth in the toughest challenge ever - the transformation of a 33-storey penthouse on the Gold Coast.

Perfect fit: Kyly told The Daily Telegraph on Wednesday: 'This is bringing two of my career loves together, interior design and TV presenting'

With more to gain but even more to lose, teams will be desperate to succeed as they attempt to please the new judges who have their own sky-high expectations.

Kyly has forged a career as an interior designer through her brand Lifestyled, and has her own range of candles and diffusers.

The brunette, who wed Michael, 38, in 2012, welcomed the couple's daughter, Kelsey-Lee, in November 2015.

Power couple: Kyly wed Australian retired cricketer Michael Clarke (pictured), 38, in 2012

Juggling her empire with motherhood, Kyly revealed on the Nine Honey Mums podcast in August last year, that she's content with their family-of-three.

'In all honesty we absolutely love where we're at, and we love Kelsey-Lee and the fact we have so much time to dedicate to her, and both Michael and I are running extremely busy businesses and schedules at the moment,' she said.

'We're just happy,' Kyly added. 'We're really happy with the family that we have.'
description: Interior designer and mother-of-one Kyly Clarke,  38, has landed her 'dream job' as a new judge on Seven's House Rules for 2020.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
